screen.lightwithin.luxdialogue.activatio: There are a few ways
Some more safe and natural, some dangerous but convenient
The safe one
The convenient one
Your light will help you whenever you are in need
When in dangerous places or times, it will show itself to you, with this symbol:
When you are ready to activate it, do it!
I believe your kind calls it 'pressing the activate button %s'
In which ways your light senses danger, varies
Would you like to know how your light does it?
Yes please
No need
Tell me more, in general
Typically, most lights detect danger in two or three steps
The first consists of a 'wake up' when a potentially harmful event occurs
For example, when you get slightly harmed by a foe or fall from a height
In the next step, it verifies how many 'dangers' are present
Like you (or your allies!) being surrounded, or badly wounded, and so on
Finally, some lights benefit from a 'catalyst' of sorts
The likes of: source of fire or frost, the rain and others
If enough of these 'conditions' are met, then it will 'trigger'
And you will be able to harness its powers
Are you satisfied with the explanation?
Yes, thank you
Ah ah, no.
There actually is a way to store 'light charges'
These charges allow you to unleash your light in whichever moment you desire
But there is a catch
They usually put quite the strain on your light
You can only store a few of them at a time
and when you use them, your light will need a longer rest
Not everyone's light can support the same amount of charges
Some may not even support any number of them!
You can even see if another light bearer is storing them because
they will glow and emit some particles if they have a lot of them
On top of that, they are quite tricky to obtain
I can, however, teach you how. Would like to know?
Yes please
No, changed my mind
